channel.title: Kramer Elementary School News
channel.description: News and announcements from Kramer Elementary School, including events, activities, and important dates.

item.title: PTG Meeting Rescheduled and Community Updates
item.description:
The November 18th PTG meeting has been rescheduled to Tuesday, December 2nd at 7 PM (virtual meeting). This allows members to attend the "Building a Tech Healthy Household" seminar on November 18th at THS auditorium (6-7:30 PM). Additional updates include: Oxford Lions Club collecting used eyeglasses and cases for children in need (donate by early December to Betsy Beaton at Marshall Elementary or Shaunna Tafelski at Board Office), Kramer's Read At Home (RAH) program for K-2nd graders with first reward day September 24th, and a reminder to link your Kroger Rewards card to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards.

PTG Meeting (Rescheduled)

Building a Tech Healthy Household Seminar

item.title: Talawanda Food Pantry and Resources
item.description:
The Kramer Free Pantry is located at the entrance of Kramer and is stocked with free food and hygiene items for all students, including cereal, fruit, veggies, peanut butter, spaghetti, mac and cheese, soup, shampoo, and toothbrushes. Students can take any items they need for their families. For questions, donations, or to access additional Talawanda family resources, contact Chelsea Pike (Kramer Social Worker) at 513-273-3511 or pikec@talawanda.org, or drop donations at the Kramer office.

View original newsletter

item.title: Weekly Update and Report Card Distribution
item.description:
Week ending November 6, 2025 at Kramer. Colder temperatures expected next week, so students should dress warmly. Report cards will be distributed on Friday, November 14th.

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Unplug and Play Event at Kramer Playground
item.description:
Unplug & Play Kramer is a flashlight fun event at dusk on Wednesday, November 5, 2025 from 5:30-7:00 PM at the Kramer playground. Kids receive a flashlight and engage in independent creative play while parents relax and chat with other parents and staff. Bring a lawn chair! Additional items include: a PTG meeting on Tuesday, December 2nd at 7PM (virtual), a LaRosa's Pizza fundraiser on Thursday, November 13 from 4PM-close (mention Kramer on receipt), and Reading At Home (RAH) program for K-2nd graders starting September 24th. Connect your Kroger Rewards card to Kramer PTG at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards to support the school.

Unplug & Play Kramer - Flashlight Fun at Dusk

item.title: Halloween Celebration and Lost & Found Reminder
item.description:
Kramer Elementary celebrated Halloween this week with class parties and a parade. Thank you to all parents and volunteers who helped! Important reminders: - Check the lost and found - there's a large pile of items. View photos in the newsletter or visit the office. Unclaimed items will be donated after Thanksgiving break. - No school Tuesday, November 4th for Election Day.

item.title: Community Events and School Calendar
item.description:
The Community Page features local resources and upcoming school events. PUSH (People United for Self Help) provides grants to low-income homeowners in the Talawanda School District for critical and emergency home repairs - call 513-523-8100 or visit http://www.push-oxford.org/. View the full community events page at the link above.

Key upcoming dates include: - No School: Nov 4 (Professional Development), Nov 24-28 (Thanksgiving Break), Dec 22-Jan 6 (Winter Break) - Music Concerts: Nov 12 (4th Grade), Dec 3 (5th Grade), Feb 25 (3rd Grade), Mar 10 (2nd Grade) - Special Events: Mother/Son Dance (Jan 31), Field Day (May 8), Last Day of School (May 21)

Full calendar details are listed in the original post.

item.title: November 2025 Lunch Menu Available
item.description:
The Kramer Elementary November 2025 lunch menu features daily meal options with a choice of milk included. Notable items include: - Monday, November 3: Fish Sandwich or Popcorn Shrimp, Fish Nuggets, Homestyle Baked Beans, Celery Sticks with Ranch, Mixed Fruit - Tuesday, November 4: No School - Wednesday, November 5: Beef Pretzel Dog, Seasoned Green Beans, Fresh Cucumber Slices with Ranch, Fresh Grapes - Thursday, November 6: National Nacho Day - Tortilla Chips, Warm Cheese Cup & Salsa, Taco Fiesta Black Beans, Salsa or Marinara Cup, Pineapple Tidbits - Friday, November 7: 4x6 Rectangle Cheese Pizza, Honey Glazed Carrots, Fresh Romaine Garden Salad, Frozen Fruit Sidekick - Monday, November 18: Holiday Meal - Roast Turkey and Gravy, Garlic Knot Roll, Mashed Potatoes, Seasoned Green Beans, Pumpkin Applesauce - November 24-28: Thanksgiving Break - No School

Menu is subject to change based on product availability.

item.title: PTG Updates: Conference Meals, Reading Program, and Kroger Rewards
item.description:
Conference Meal Thanks: PTG thanks volunteers and donors, especially El Potrero, for supporting teacher and staff conference meals.

Read At Home (RAH) Program: Kindergarten through 2nd grade families can participate in the voluntary reading program starting Wednesday, September 24th (first reward day). Students record books read at home and turn in sheets weekly for alternating rewards: student-selected books or small prizes.

Kroger Community Rewards: Connect your Kroger Rewards card to Kramer PTG once, and Kroger will donate a percentage of your purchases to the PTG. Sign up at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Community Events and School Calendar
item.description:
The community page highlights several upcoming opportunities and events: - Trunk or Treat sponsored by BT/Talawanda FCCLA on Tuesday, October 28th from 6-7:30 PM (scan QR code to register for a trunk spot) - Veterans Day Breakfast and Assembly on Tuesday, November 11, 2025 at Talawanda High School (breakfast at 7:30 AM, assembly at 9:00 AM - RSVP required) - Shoe donation drive through December 1st to support a Talawanda family raising money for their daughter's service dog through 4Paws for Ability - Vivo Coro Oxford (Cincinnati Youth Choir) for grades 3-6 meets Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University - English Language Caf at Miami University offers free English practice sessions on Tuesdays 6-7 PM in MacMillan Hall Room 017 - Bus drivers needed - Petermann Transportation is hiring at $20/hr starting rate

A comprehensive school calendar lists important dates including no school days, concerts, field trips, PTG meetings, and special events through May 2025.

item.title: PTG Updates and Programs
item.description:
Conference Meal Thanks: Thank you to volunteers and donors (especially El Potrero) who supported teacher/staff conference meals.

RAH Program: Reading At Home (RAH) for K-2nd graders begins Wednesday, September 24thfirst reward day! Students record books read at home weekly and earn alternating rewards (student-selected book or small prize). Return RAH sheets by Wednesday.

Kroger Rewards: Link your Kroger Rewards card to Kramer PTG (one-time signup) so Kroger donates a percentage of your purchases to PTG: https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards

Add to Calendar: Google Calendar | iCal | Outlook

View original newsletter

item.title: Health Guidelines from Nurse Briede
item.description:
Contact Information: Nurse Virginia Briede - briedev@talawanda.org, 513-273-3554

When to Keep Students Home: - Fever of 100F or more: Student must stay home until fever-free for 24 hours minimum without medication (Tylenol or Motrin) - Vomiting/diarrhea: Student must be free of symptoms for 24 hours before returning to school

Head Lice Alert: A few cases have been detected in the building. Check your child's hair regularly, especially after sleepovers. Avoid sharing brushes. If treatment is needed, wash all bedding and dry on high heat. Contact the clinic for assistance purchasing lice treatment. [Link provided for article: "Staying Ahead of Head Lice"]

View original newsletter

item.description:
Project Reboot is a program available to students. Learn more about the program and how to participate by visiting projectreboot.school.

item.title: Community Events and School Calendar
item.description:
The Community Page highlights upcoming local events and activities, including: - Veterans Day Breakfast & Assembly (Nov 11) at Talawanda High School - breakfast at 7:30 AM, assembly at 9:00 AM - Trunk or Treat (Oct 28, 6-7:30 PM) - TSD approved for distribution - Tech Healthy Household presentation (Nov 18, 6-7:30 PM) by Dino Ambrosi from Project Reboot at Talawanda High School - Unplug & Play at Kramer (Nov 5, 5:30-7:00 PM) - flashlight fun at dusk on Kramer playground - Shoe donation drive (through Dec 1) to support a Talawanda family raising money for a service dog through 4Paws for Ability - Vivo Coro Oxford (Cincinnati Youth Choir) for grades 3-6, Thursdays 6:00-7:00 PM at Miami University - English Language Caf at Miami University (Tuesdays 6-7 PM, MacMillan Hall Room 017) starting Sept 16 - Bus drivers needed - Petermann Transportation hiring, $20/hr starting pay

The school calendar includes key dates: conferences (Oct 14 & 16), fall break (Oct 17), Thanksgiving break (Nov 24-28), winter break (Dec 22-Jan 6), and spring break (Mar 30-Apr 6).

Parent-Teacher Conferences

item.title: PTG Updates: Conferences, Carnival Success, and Reading Programs
item.description:
Parent-Teacher Conferences are scheduled for Tuesday, October 14 and Thursday, October 16. PTG is providing meals (Thursday donated by El Potrero) and needs parent volunteers to donate appetizers, desserts, and help with setup/cleanup. Sign up here.

The Kramer Carnival raised $10,482 for students, showing growth from $8,986 (2023) and $10,002 (2024). Committee thanks all volunteers and asks attendees to complete a feedback survey.

Reading At Home (RAH) program for K-2nd graders begins Wednesday, September 24th with first reward day. Students record books read at home and earn rewards. Connect your Kroger Rewards card to Kramer PTG for automatic donations at https://www.kroger.com/i/community/community-rewards.

Parent-Teacher Conference Meals (Tuesday)

item.title: Office Updates: Fees, Lunch Accounts, and Forms
item.description:
Student fees are now available to pay online through Payschools Central or in the office with cash/check. Lunch accounts can be funded through Payschools Central; accounts reaching -$50 will be added to school fees. Apply for free/reduced lunch through the Kramer office or social worker Chelsea Pikefree lunch qualifies you for waived fees (except 5th grade Chromebook), and reduced lunch gets 85% off fees plus free meals. Update any contact information changes (phone, address, pickup contacts) through Final Forms; address changes require new proof of residency submitted to the office.

View original newsletter

item.title: Picture Retake Day - Thursday, November 16
item.description:
Picture Retake Day is Thursday, November 16th. Only students who are ordering retakes or who were absent on the original September picture day will be photographed. Visit the Lifetouch website to order photos online using Picture Day ID: EVTJQK944. Orders will be sent home with students after Picture Retake Day.

item.title: Unplug and Play Event at Kramer Playground
item.description:
Unplug & Play Kramer is a flashlight fun event at dusk on Wednesday, November 5, 2025 from 5:30-7:00 PM at Kramer playground. Parents should bring a lawn chair to relax and chat with other parents and staff while kids engage in independent creative play. Kids will receive a flashlight at the event.

item.description:

item.title: Counselor Corner: Health Curriculum and Support Services
item.description:
Contact Information: Counselor Durham can be reached at durhamr@talawanda.org or (513) 273-3553.

Senate Bill 288 Health Education Update: Ohio schools are required to provide developmentally appropriate prevention education on sexual abuse and sexual violence (K-12). Instruction was provided last week. View curricula: K-3 Curriculum | 4-6 Curriculum | More info from Ohio DEW

Lunch with the Counselor: The counselor invites small groups of students to lunch daily to build relationships. In September, focus is on kindergarten students. Small group and individual counseling support is available for self-regulation, coping skills, relationships, etc. Parents can complete permission forms: Small Group/Lunch Bunch Form 25-26 | Individual Counseling Form 25-26

View original newsletter
